root.title: Dayan Memorial Complex, The
root.history: The complex belongs to the western Turkic ethnos.
root.names: The local people call the complex “The Dayan Bataar monuments”, “The Dayan lake monuments”.
root.place: The memorial complex is located on southeast side of lake Dayan Nuur of Tsengel sum in Bayan-Ölgii aimag at N48º16´063´´ - E088º52´982´´, on 2241m above the sea level.
root.store: The memorial is on its site.
root.general: There are two quadrangle barrows, a stone sculpture and a stele.
root.size: The barrows’ size: 4х4 m. The stone sculpture size: 160х35-39х18-19 cm.
root.investigation: G.N.Potanin 482 for the first time has published portrayals of the stone sculpture. The Mongolian archeologist N.Ser-Odzhav 483 has published a brief announcement in 1960. He considers a cross sign on the chest of the sculpture as Jesus Christ symbol. But D.Bayar claims that the sign is not Jesus Christ cross, but sign of an eagle 484. D.Kubarev and D.Tseveendorzh, members of Mongolia-USA-Russia joint expedition, have published a general description and some pictures of the “Dayan” memorial complex 485.
